lead_paragraph: The thousands trapped on roadways included students returning from an anti-abortion rally in Washington, a college gymnastics team and a men’s basketball team.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Atlanta, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL, ALAN BLINDER and MITCH SMITH

headline.print_headline: Stranded on Snowed-In Kentucky Interstate, Travelers Ration Food and Wait
headline.main: Stranded in the Snow, Travelers Camp in Cars and Make Do

snippet: The thousands trapped on roadways included students returning from an anti-abortion rally in Washington, a college gymnastics team and a men’s basketball team.
abstract: Snow storm brings traffic to halt on Kentucky's Interstate 75, where weekend storm's intensity caught people by surprise, and forced those stranded to remain in their cars for hours, some overnight, without food or water; Kentucky State Police delivered food and fuel to stranded motorists.
